question: National Disaster Response Fund is located in which account / fund?
explanation: National Disaster Response Fund has been established under Section 46 of the Disaster Management Act, 2005 (DM Act) as a fund managed by the Central Government for meeting the expenses for emergency response, relief and rehabilitation due to any threatening disaster situation or disaster. Prior to September 2010, it used to be National Calamity Contingency Fund (NCCF). It is located in "Public Accounts" of Government of India under "Reserve Funds not bearing interest".
